data.text: @EricTopol @Nature @kennethbaillie @EdinburghUni @GenomicsEngland Could this also help explain secondary attack rates in families?

@EricTopol @Nature @kennethbaillie @EdinburghUni @GenomicsEngland 🙌 and in June 2020 we published 68 novel genes we associated with severe COVID-19 in our analysis of 779 patients in @uk_biobank. Since then >70% of the genetic factors we identified for severe COVID-19 have been independently validated in global studies https://t.co/7kPiYoO2yM
@EricTopol @kennethbaillie @Nature @EdinburghUni @GenomicsEngland phenomenal collaborative effort leading to the identification of novel and important #COVID19 genetic risk loci
@EricTopol @Nature @kennethbaillie @EdinburghUni @GenomicsEngland This would be more meaningful if medical providers took genetic results seriously.

@EricTopol @Nature @kennethbaillie @EdinburghUni @GenomicsEngland Another article w/blood proteins affecting severe COVID https://t.co/550SvZ2Eq6

Blood proteins that ⬆️ hosp. or death:
🩸GCNT4, CD207, RAB14, C1GALT1C1, and ABO 
🩸FAAH2

Blood proteins that ⬇️ hosp. or death:
🩸SELL, SELE, and PECAM-1 
🩸LCTL, SFTPD, KEL, and ATP2A3
🩸ICAM-1

@EricTopol @Nature @kennethbaillie @EdinburghUni @GenomicsEngland @MJ_Humphries Myeloid cell adhesion
molecules (SELE, ICAM5, CD209) in COVID-19.
@EricTopol @Nature @kennethbaillie @EdinburghUni @GenomicsEngland the blood clotting is very serious in heart attack too in covid

@EricTopol @Nature @kennethbaillie @EdinburghUni @GenomicsEngland Global #COVID death reaches over six million. A mournful landmark yet the key news channels are silent. Stay safe. Covid hasn’t gone away!
https://t.co/EWq4y3R4HA
